intro: Strongyleria leiophylla, commonly known as the smooth-leaved strongyleria, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically smooth and glossy. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Strongyleria leiophylla is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
